description.narrative: The area comprising the Red Sea and the Horn of Africa currently forms a major theatre in several#overlapping conflict systems that are operating at local, national, regional and geo-strategic levels.#Shifting alliances and political instability characteri ze the region. In large part, Yemen remains the#only open widespread armed conflict. However, unpredictability is a defining feature of both sides of#the Red Sea. The potential for spill-over and a resurgence of other conflicts remains a tangible threat.#E xtant and latent conflicts include but are not limited to territorial disputes, internal ethno-political#divisions and competition for scarce natural resources. Each of these issues require a contextually#appropriate approach whilst ensuring sensitivity to the broader conflict system.##The heightened tensions in the region and the conflicts surrounding it are not only resulting in protracted violence and poverty but also increasingly deepening divisions. In a region ravaged by conflicts, political reform an d economic prosperity are becoming threadbare. The states in the Red Sea region are divided along multiple fault lines, with some states denied access to political or economic power because of how they identify their strategic interests and are identified by others. The current fragmentation and competing interests within the Red Sea region will continue to fuel instability and undermine common understanding and multilateralism. ##The overall objective of CMI?s project is to enhance regional cooperation on conflict prevention around the Red Sea. CMI?s specific objectives are to a) foster channels of communication, trust and shared understanding of the key regional challenges, among Red Sea national and regional stakeholders, b) provide jointly developed anal ysis and recommendations to national, regional and international bodies responsible of conflict prevention in Red Sea, c) support the emergence of inclusive, regionally owned mechanisms for multilateral cooperation, and d) enhance agency and capacities of key actors focusing on conflict resolution and prevention in the Horn of Africa. CMI?s project seeks to complement the emerging formal multilateral initiatives and processes, such as the work of IGAD and the Red Sea Council.
